story:
Once upon a time, in the ancient city of Baghdad, there lived a young boy named Malik. Malik was a curious boy who loved to explore the bustling markets and winding alleys of the city. His favorite place to visit was the grand bazaar, where merchants from far and wide gathered to sell their wares.

One day, as Malik wandered through the bazaar, he came across a mysterious old man sitting at a small table covered with colorful stones. The man had a gentle smile and wise eyes that seemed to hold untold secrets. Intrigued, Malik approached the old man and asked him what he was selling.

The old man chuckled softly and replied, "I am not selling these stones, my boy. I am a storyteller, and each of these stones holds a tale from a far-off land. Choose one, and I will tell you a story."

Excited, Malik picked a bright blue stone from the table, and the old man began to weave a magical tale of adventure and bravery. As the old man spoke, Malik felt as if he were being transported to a distant realm filled with wonders and dangers.

By the time the story ended, the sun had begun to set, and Malik realized it was time to go home. He thanked the old man for the wonderful story and tucked the blue stone into his pocket as a reminder of the magical night.

That night, as Malik lay in bed, he closed his eyes and drifted off to sleep, dreaming of the far-off lands he had heard about in the old man's story. And as he slept, he could almost hear the old man's voice whispering words of wisdom and courage in his ear.

And so, dear child, remember that stories have the power to transport us to new worlds, where anything is possible. Close your eyes now and let your dreams take you on your own magical adventure. Good night, sweet child, and may your dreams be filled with wonder and joy.
